snippet: Public records and interviews with relatives and neighbors of Pedro Hernandez, who confessed to killing 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979, indicate a life of turbulence.
abstract: Public records and interviews with relatives and neighbors of Pedro Hernandez, who has confessed to killing 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979, indicate a life of turbulence;  to the police, he is a killer who spent much of his confession describing frequent childhood beatings; his lawyer and his wife say he is a man with a history of schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, hallucinations and delusions who confessed to a crime he did not commit.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD, ALISON LEIGH COWAN and KIA GREGORY
byline.contributor: Nate Schweber contributed reporting from New Jersey, Dennis M. Rivera-Pichardo from Yabucoa, P.R., and Alain Delaquérière from New York.

lead_paragraph: Public records and interviews with relatives and neighbors of Pedro Hernandez, who confessed to killing 6-year-old Etan Patz in 1979, indicate a life of turbulence.

headline.seo: For Patz Suspect, a Tumultuous Past
headline.main: For Patz Suspect, a Life Filled With Tumult and Family Mistrust
headline.print_headline: For Patz Suspect, a Life Filled With Tumult and Family Mistrust
